Detailed Description

The class defintes a frame work creating data filters which can manipulate images, and apply any changes in the image data back to the image.

The class is used within the VideoStream package to allow for the creation of various image filters, which can be applied to a stream and the results will be visible in real time.

Richard Edwards

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Filter::Filter ( int  imageHeight,
int  imageWidth,
int  colorMode 
)

Parameters:
imageHeight - the height of images to be manipulated.
imageWidth - the width of images to be manipulated.
colorMode - An integer to determine the current color space. (0 - GrayScale, 1 - RGB, 2 - RGB Blob)

Member Function Documentation

void Filter::applyFilter ( unsigned char *   ) 

A function for applying the filter to an image. Note, one should always invoke applyFilter, and not invoke filter.

The reasoning behind this will be more clear, when the class is extended to allow for a filter to yield data from its application.

int Filter::getHeight (  )

Returns the image height.

Returns the image width.

int Filter::getColorMode (  ) 

Returns:
Retuns the color Mode.

virtual void Filter::filter ( unsigned char *   )  [virtual]

The function used by applyFilter to actually process an image. However, when developing your own filter, if you do not overwrite this function, then the filter's default behavior is to do nothing.
